title: <ExtColorselector></ExtColorselector>

docProperties.name: alphaDecimalFormat
docProperties.text:
The format used by {@link Ext.util.Format#method!number Ext.util.Format#number} to format the alpha channel's
value.

docProperties.name: cancelButtonText
color
docProperties.text:
This config property is used internally by the UI to maintain the full color.
Changes to this config are automatically reflected in `{@link #cfg!value value}` and vise-versa.
Setting `{@link #cfg!value value}` can, however, cause the alpha to be dropped if the new value
does not contain an alpha component.

docProperties.name: fieldPad
docProperties.text: padding between the sliders and HEX/R/G/B fields.

docProperties.name: fieldWidth
docProperties.text:
Width of the text fields on the container (excluding HEX);
since the width of the slider containers is the same as the text field under it
(it's the same vbox column), changing this value will also affect the spacing between
the sliders.

docProperties.name: format
docProperties.text:
The color format to for the `{@link #cfg!value value}` config. The `{@link #cfg!value value}` can be set using any
supported format or named color, but the stored value will always be in this
format.

Supported formats are:

- hex6 - For example "ffaa00" (Note: does not preserve transparency).
- hex8 - For eaxmple "ffaa00ff" - the last 2 digits represent transparency
- #hex6 - For example "#ffaa00" (same as "hex6" but with a leading "#").
- #hex8 - For example "#ffaa00ff" (same as "hex8" but with a leading "#").
- HEX6 - Same as "hex6" but upper case.
- HEX8 - Same as "hex8" but upper case.
- #HEX6 - Same as "#hex6" but upper case.
- #HEX8 - Same as "#hex8" but upper case.

docProperties.name: okButtonText
showOkCancelButtons
docProperties.text:
Whether Ok and Cancel buttons (in upper right, below the selected color preview) should
be shown;
these are relied upon by the {@link Ext.ux.colorpick.Button} and the
{@link Ext.ux.colorpick.Field}.

docProperties.name: showPreviousColor
docProperties.text:
Whether "previous color" region (in upper right, below the selected color preview) should
be shown;
these are relied upon by the {@link Ext.ux.colorpick.Button} and the
{@link Ext.ux.colorpick.Field}.

docProperties.name: value
docProperties.text: The initial color to highlight; see {@link #cfg!format #format} for supported formats.

propertyString:
alphaDecimalFormat
  import React, { Component } from 'react';
  import { ExtColorselector } from "@sencha/ext-react-modern";

    render() {
      return (
        <ExtColorselector alphaDecimalFormat=''></ExtColorselector>
      )
    }
  }
